intro: Melandrium baldwinii, commonly known as the Baldwin's catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its flowers are pink to reddish in color and bloom in late spring to early summer. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds.
